main.name: Beau Williams
main.description: Scroll down for a little bit about me
main.bio: I've loved all things computers my whole life. My family tells me that when I was a little boy there were only ever two things I would ask for, 'can I have a bikkie' and 'can I play on the compooter'. I'm trying not to get too comfortable in any specific language or technology stack, but to develop routines that allow me to freely move from one to the next with ease.
main.contactmessage: You can reach out to me via email, LinkedIn or GitHub

resume.skillmessage: Some languages and technologies I have recent experience with. By no means exhaustive.

education.description: Currently the Google Student Developer Club lead, also enjoy participating in research workshops and active on the computing discord channel

work.title: Tech/Business Operations
work.description: Using my past experience in business development, technical support and my knowledge and expertise in software engineering & cybersecurity I am helping to support this growing business. By taking a jack of all trades position my goal here is to implement processes and strategies I have learnt over the years during my short career - such as modernising how we communicate, how we manage information internally, ensuring data is handled correctly, maintaining an exceptional level of customer service as a company and managing customer feedback on the platform so that improvments are made in line with their expectations.

work.title: Scooter Coach
work.description: One of my passions growing up was scootering, I have spent a huge part of my life doing it and it has taught me great insights about myself. My proudest achievement is taking a best trick prize at an Australian street competition. I was invited to teach the children scooter lessons at Northern Beaches Christian School for their school sport. I had so much fun doing it, and was great to help them learn new tricks and have a great afternoon doing it. Overall this is my first experience being paid to coach kids, and I realised quickly it can be a lot harder than it seems! I took advice from the experienced skateboarding coaches and watched how they do it and eventually found my rhythm. Best thing about this job is it gave me time to focus on pivoting back to a technical field during 2019.

work.title: Business Development APAC
work.description: At Auth0 I was pleased to have the opportunity to lead outbound engagement for the APAC region. My strategic abilities are paramount in combination with my ability to engage cold with CTO's and other tech heads in leading Australian organisations through a targeted omnichannel approach, in part developed through my experience.

projects.title: JavaVim Auto Enviroment Build
projects.category: Lightweight Java Development Environment Containers with automated vim setup - simply run and code

projects.title: School24 Company Site
projects.category: Built in 6 days. Designed, copywritten, brand colours, entire site. An exercise in how fast I could make a production quality site.

projects.title: Microsoft Student Accelerator Bootcamp Content (AI/ML)
projects.category: Some guides to deploy an ML model, plus more wrapped in a nice site

projects.title: DSC MQ Website
projects.category: Built and delpoyed a website borring a design from ATC uni for the launch of the Macquarie University Google Developer Student club that I lead

recommendations.text: I worked with Beau for a number of years, he is young, bright and full of enthusiasm. He has a solid understanding of the industry he works in and keeps his finger on the pulse when it comes to what is upcoming and relevant. He is a great team player, honest and sincere and a joy to work with.
